alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Erie; Huron; Lorain; Medina (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 11:22PM EDT until August 24 at 5:15AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Ashland County in north central Ohio... Erie County in north central Ohio... Northeastern Huron County in north central Ohio... Southwestern Lorain County in north central Ohio... Southwestern Medina County in northeastern Ohio... * Until 515 AM EDT. * At 1122 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lorain, Sandusky, Western Vermilion, Vermilion, Amherst, Wellington, Wakeman, Sullivan, Penfield, Marblehead, Spencer, Berlin Heights, Kipton, Rochester, Birmingham, Fairview Lanes and Sandusky South. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
